sen.j: 山城国一揆（やましろのくにいっき）は、1485年（文明 (日本)17年）、山城国（現在の京都府南部）南半の上三郡（久世郡、綴喜郡、相楽郡）で起きた。
sen.e: Yamashiro no kuniikki (the uprising in Yamashiro Province) occurred in three southern counties (Kuse-gun, Tsuzuki-gun and Soraku-gun) of Yamashiro Province (currently the southern part of Kyoto Prefecture) in 1485.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Yamashiro no kuniikki (the uprising in Yamashiro Province) occurred in three southern counties (Kuse-gun, Tsuzuki-gun and Soraku-gun) of Yamashiro Province (currently the southern part of Kyoto Prefecture) in 1485.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: Yamashiro no kuniikki (the uprising in Yamashiro Province) occurred in three southern counties (Kuse-gun, Tsuzuki-gun and Soraku-gun) of Yamashiro Province (currently the southern part of Kyoto Prefecture) in 1485.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 国人や農民が協力し、守護大名畠山氏の政治的影響力を排除し、以後8年間自治を行った。
sen.e: Kokujin (local samurai) and farmers cooperated to eliminate the political influence of the Shugo Daimyo (Military Governor) of the Hatakeyama clan, and governed by themselves for the next eight years.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Kokujin (local samurai) and farmers cooperated to eliminate the political influence of the Shugo Daimyo (Military Governor) of the Hatakeyama clan, and governed themselves for the next eight years.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: Local samurais and farmers cooperated to eliminate the political influence of the shugo daimyo (military governor) of the Hatakeyama clan, and functioned as self-governing community for the succeeding eight years.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

Characteristics of the uprising in Yamashiro Province

sen.j: 一般的に国人が起こした一揆のことを国一揆という。

sen.e: An uprising started by kokujin (local samurai) is generally called kuniikki (an uprising in a province).

sen.j: 山城国一揆は惣の農民らが参加している点で厳密には国一揆ではなく惣国一揆とでも言うべきものである。
sen.e: Strictly speaking, the uprising in Yamashiro should be called as sokokuikki, not kuniikki, because the uprising was started by farmers in so (so village, which is a community consisting of peasants' self-governing association).

sen.e: Strictly speaking, the uprising in Yamashiro Province was not a "kuniikki" but a "sokoku ikki", because the uprising was started by farmers belonging to so (a community organized by a self-governing association of farmers).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。kuniikki および sokoku ikki にダブルクォーテーションを追記しました。

sen.j: 南山城でも例外ではなかった。
sen.e: Minami-Yamashiro is not an exception.

sen.e: Minami-Yamashiro is not an exception.

sen.j: 畠山氏は跡目争いから畠山義就と畠山政長が争いを続けていた。
sen.e: In the Hatakeyama clan, Yoshinari HATAKEYAMA and Masanaga HATAKEYAMA continued to fight with each other because of a dispute about the succession.

sen.e: As for the Hatakeyama clan, Yoshinari HATAKEYAMA and Masanaga HATAKEYAMA had been at war with each other for a dispute over a matter of succession.

sen.j: 1478年の畠山氏任命まで、本来、山城国には、名目上の守護しか置かれていなかった。
sen.e: Only Shugo (Military Governor) had long been nominally appointed in Yamashiro Province until 1478 when the Hatakeyama clan was appointed.

sen.e: Only Shugo (Military Governor) had long been nominally appointed in Yamashiro Province until 1478 when the Hatakeyama clan was appointed.

sen.e: Until the time when the Hatakeyama clan was appointed in 1478, only a nominally appointed Shugo had served Yamashiro Province.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: しかし同年後は本格的な領国化を目指す動きが盛んになっていた。
sen.e: Since then, a movement for full territorialization became active.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Since then, a movement for full territorialization became active.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: After the appointment of the Hatakeyama clan, however, a movement to become a fully independent territory started to intensify.
sen.cmt: 領国化はto become a fully independent territoryと訳しました。FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: その中で繰り広げられた長年にわたる戦いで国人衆や農民は疲弊した。
sen.e: In such a movement, kokujin (local samurai) and farmers became impoverished due to the long-standing fight.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: During such movements, kokujin (local samurai) and farmers became impoverished due to the long-standing fight.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: As a result, local samurais and farmers of the province became impoverished due to the long-standing fights.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: そして山城国一揆の土壌が整うこととなった。
sen.e: Everything was ready for them to start an uprising in Yamashiro Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Everything was in place for the start of an uprise in Yamashiro Province.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: Such a circumstance prepared the backdrop for the uprising in Yamashiro Province.

sen.j: 1485年、南山城の国人衆や農民らが宇治の平等院に集まり評定を持った。
sen.e: In 1485, local samurai and farmers in Minami-Yamashiro gathered in the Uji Byodoin Temple to conduct a conference.
In 1485, local samurai and farmers in Minami-Yamashiro gathered in the Uji Byodoin Temple to conduct a conference.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In 1485, local samurais and farmers in Minami-Yamashiro gathered in Byodoin Temple in Uji to conduct a conference.
sen.cmt: 一部表現を修正しました。

sen.j: この評定で「国中掟法」を取り決め、両畠山氏の影響を排除し、南山城の自治を行うことを決めた。
sen.e: In the conference, they stipulated an autonomous law called Kunijuokite, and decided to eliminate the influence of both HATAKEYAMAs, and to govern by themselves in Minami-Yamashiro.
During the conference, they stipulated an autonomous law called Kunijuokite, and decided to eliminate the influence of both HATAKEYAMAs, and to govern themselves in Minami-Yamashiro.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: During the conference, they stipulated an autonomous law called "Kunijuokite", and decided to eliminate the influence of both HATAKEYAMAs in order for Minami-Yamashiro to become a self-governing community.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。ダブルクォーテーションを全角から半角に修正しました。

sen.j: 国人衆により政治がおこなわれ、南山城は惣国とよばれる政治形態となった。
sen.e: In a new regime, local samurai conducted the affairs of the province, and Minami-Yamashiro was called Sokoku (a federation of so villages).
In the new regime, local samurai conducted the affairs of the province, and Minami-Yamashiro was called Sokoku (a federation of so villages).

sen.e: The new regime of Minami-Yamashiro, where the local samurais conducted the affairs of the province, assumed a political form called "Sokoku" (a federation of so villages).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。Sokoku にダブルクォーテーションを追記しました。

sen.j: 室町幕府では、幕府のお膝元である山城国が有力守護の支配下に入る事を望んでいなかった。

sen.j: そのため、管領細川政元らは、この動きに対して静観の姿勢を取った。

sen.e: Politics administrated by local samurai created a conflict between local samurai and farmers, and a conflict among local samurai.

sen.e: Politics administrated by local samurai created a conflict between local samurai and farmers, and a conflict among local samurai.

sen.j: 1493年（明応2年）には自ら自治を放棄する集会を開き惣国は解体され、新しい守護の伊勢貞陸の支配下に入ることになった。
sen.e: In 1493, Sokoku held a rally to abandon its autonomy and disorganize itself, and it was put under the rule of Sadamichi ISE, a newly appointed Shugo Daimyo (Military Governor),

sen.j: これに反対する一部の国人衆は稲屋妻城に立てこもって抵抗した。
